page.title: 07CASE STUDY OF A SMALL FARM
page.content: Little Broadstone Farm is a 40 acre farm on the Weald growing grass for hay and silage, grazing bought in steers in Summer and keeping sheep in Winter, and operating an intensive pig unit. The pig unit is the main enterprise consisting of 90 breeding sows and 5 boars, producing 1900 pork pigs per year. All replacement breeding stock is home bred, using AI for genetic improvement. Piglets are weaned at 3 weeks and transferred to fattening pens where they are fed dry meal consisting of ground barley and protein concentrate. They are ready for slaughter at 63 kgs. live weight at 118 days old. Silage is fed to the cattle in winter and most of the hay is sold. Husband and wife work the farm, with one full time employee.
